channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Go seeks better opportunities for informal settlers
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: A lawmaker has called on concerned government agencies to facilitate a comprehensive assessment of the population and situation of informal settler families, especially in Metro Manila, to provide better opportunities for them to start anew after the coronavirus disease 2019 crisis.

item.title: PMA sets virtual graduation rites without relatives
item.author: Artemio Dumlao
item.description: Members of the Philippine Military Academy graduating class of 2020 will receive their diplomas without their parents and other loved ones on May 22.

item.title: 13 million beneficiaries to get second SAP tranche
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: At least 13 million beneficiaries from areas living in the enhanced community quarantine areas will be covered under the second tranche of the Social Amelioration Program, presidential spokesman Harry Roque Jr. said yesterday.

item.title: Extended work hours eyed in LTO
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: Amid the increasing backlog in the renewal of licenses and car registrations, the Land Transportation Office is planning to extend its work hours and have its offices open on Saturdays in general community quarantin areas.

item.title: 10 LGU execs told to explain violation of quarantine rules
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: Over 10 local officials have been issued show cause orders by the Department of the Interior and Local Government over violations on the prohibition of mass gatherings and parties amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Government admits backlog in COVID testing
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The government is optimistic that it will be able to address the backlog in coronavirus testing in two weeks as it expects the country’s testing capacity to increase with the help of the private sector.

item.title: DA seeks P66 billion stimulus package
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: The Department of Agriculture has asked Congress for a P66-billion stimulus package that will help the country’s agriculture sector recover from the economic impact of the coronavirus disease 2019 crisis.

item.title: Tulong Kapatid aids Quezon City waste management teams
item.description: Tulong Kapatid, the alliance of foundations and companies in the MVP Group, has turned over face shields, grocery packs, food and bottled water to various waste management providers in Quezon City.

item.title: DOLE mulls reduced workdays in commercial firms
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: To prevent the number of jobless people from increasing further nationwide, the Department of Labor and Employment is promoting the adoption of reduced workdays in commercial establishments.

item.title: DepEd releases school calendar
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: The Department of Education has released the updated school calendar that will be used for the upcoming academic year in public elementary and high schools.
